website_summaries.verdict: With thick microfleece, thin wires, and other high-end features, this blanket is a good value on today's market.
pros: Three-inch heating grid design eliminates hot and cold spots – a common problem with cheaper electric blankets
cons: May develop an odor of "old polyester."
Two heating zones require two separate outlets

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blanket 3 months ago, and at first it worked well. The heat is very spotty and last night it caught fire. It scared me right out of the bed. Nothing was damaged, but not the kind of language I wanted my kids to hear from me. I always liked electric blankets and thought people were way too paranoid to think they might be dangerous, but this is my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the blanket itself
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the blanket itself. The wires inside cannot be felt once in it and doesn't feel like a regular warming blanket. However, the wires leading from the controller to the blanket are fragile and actually split from the plug into the blanket. I bought this blanket in July and have only recently been using it. The blanket did shut itself off once the wires detached. Would someone please post contact information, i.e. email address for seller? Also, I don't understand why Amazon is still selling his blanket after many pictures of dangerous wires and fire?
customer_reviews.author: PATRICIA HARRINGTON

customer_reviews.title: Could Easily Start A Fire
customer_reviews.text: Be careful! I had the same experience as other users. Woke up to the smell of burning plastic. And based on the pictures, it seems to burn a hole in the same place on the transformers every time. I am so relieved I got to it before it started a fire. The controls also felt very cheap, the display isn't even digital. There is a reason this blanket sells for 25% of it's "retail" price. Yikes.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Pimms

customer_reviews.title: The heater wires in the blanket probably act like a long antenna for the power supply noise
customer_reviews.text: This blanket uses a computer-type high-frequency switching power supply for the low voltage. Despite claiming to meet FCC Part15 standards, it causes so much RFI (radio noise) that it's impossible to listen to a radio nearby when the blanket is on. The heater wires in the blanket probably act like a long antenna for the power supply noise, something I would not want to sleep under.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on a regualr basis
customer_reviews.text: I'm in Maine, and it is now cold. This blanket purchased less than one year ago does not heat with any sense of even-consistency. I bought the insurance plan from Amazon (the carrier is Asuraion). Good luck getting in touch with them. SO now working EB, cold weather and there seems to be no available path to a solution. Yes I have a very high frustration level right now. I hope this saves YOU from this annoying (at most) experience.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE CARNEY

customer_reviews.title: Caught fire after three uses. What more can I ...
customer_reviews.text: Caught fire after three uses. What more can I say. Luckily we smelled burning plastic and caught it before it anything caught on fire. Rug was the only part burned.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sherman

customer_reviews.title: The best blanket ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have fibromyalgia, and this blanket makes for a good nights sleep with less pain possible. Wow! I love the low voltage, because other styles of electric blankets allow a stronger current to run over your body. Fibromyalgia makes you super-sensitive neurologically, and you feel like you're chewing on tin foil, under a regular electric blanket. Very high quality blanket, super soft, and a 10 hour timer. I use fleece sheets, so the blanket does not move about during the night. You can't tuck this blanket in, so it's important to use sheets that offer some resistance, like fleece or flannel. Waking up with less pain makes this a 10-star product!
customer_reviews.author: KcSolaris

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality and Low Voltage!
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is different from the others. It has very fine wires which makes it feel like a soft, smooth blanket. Heat distribution is not like a heating pad, but more subtle. It warms from head to toes with a soft heat, not intense. Have found that in a 58-62 degree room only need to run it on lower settings. Auto-off feature works well. Like the fact that the Low Voltage it uses makes it safer too.
customer_reviews.author: Recently there

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!! Read the reviews and believe them!
customer_reviews.text: Well like other reviewers that I should have listened to, after four months to the day the controller quit working. Too late to return it. I m not at all happy that I threw $87 bucks down the drain. With all of the same complaints about this cheap piece of junk there should be a return policy.
customer_reviews.author: aapple

customer_reviews.title: Great Electric Blanket
customer_reviews.text: Very nice blanket. The controls are easy to read, although the turn dial knob feels "cheap." However, it works great. The length of the cords is great (I have always found the cord that runs from the control to the blanket is barely long enough to reach). I also like that each control connects separately the blanket (instead of having to remember which control which side). The tiny (smaller than typical blankets) wires are great...you don't feel them at all. We like to sleep in a cold room and "snuggle" under the warmth of the blankets...and this blanket works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: WPDjr

customer_reviews.title: What Polar Vortex...
customer_reviews.text: Love that it was easy to setup, with easy instructions. After experiencing the polar vortex of 2019, this blanket was a godsend. Heat was distributed evenly and can be adjusted with two zones for two users with different needs. It's not as soft as I would have liked, not that its rough, just wanted more plushness. I also loved that its thin, but has a light weight to it, and with the pleasant warmth, it seems to envelop you and helps you sleep better, to me anyway. For those concerned about feeling wires, you feel them, of course but just barely. So they're not that noticeable. We're enjoying our blanket and hope you will too
customer_reviews.author: PMDi

customer_reviews.title: With no heat in the house, the blanket helps us sleep
customer_reviews.text: This blanket has been wonderful. My husband turns it on shortly before I go to bed and I climb into warmth and softness. Our old blanket was really heavy and we kept dismantling the sheets, but with the lighter blanket, we have much less difficulty keeping everything straight. It doesn't feel hot to the touch, but generates warmth. The 10 levels provide excellent temperature control and the on/off button and light make it easy. It's wonderful having dual controls so we can each be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Zak

customer_reviews.title: Warm and don't feel the wires
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Sunbeam heated blankets and mattress pads for years. I was frustrated that the quality seemed to be declining so thought I would try a new brand. Love this heated blanket! The wires are well protected so that I don't feel the wires even with the blanket right over the sheet. Very warm and heats evenly. Controls are easy to use and have plenty of range of warmth. Will have to wait to see how long it lasts, but would definitely purchase another SoftHeat product.
customer_reviews.author: PHA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome blanket!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this queen size Electric blanket for two years now I put it away in the summer but it is so perfect for the RV or even at home I like this one this it comes with two controllers that control each side so you can have different temps if your hot and he's cold, just came back to buy another one for the kids and realized I've had it two years now, i've washed it many times and it's still in good condition be careful to keep the controller parts away from the blanket I have a side table that I placed them on because they would get too hot
customer_reviews.author: Jpg

customer_reviews.title: Has issues at 12 months with best care!
customer_reviews.text: We loved it for a year! The 12thmonth after purchase, one side shuts off a couple of seconds after it’s turned on. This unit has been well cared for. No signs of any trouble at cords, power, controls, or blanket connection. Totally disappointed! :\
customer_reviews.author: CMG

customer_reviews.title: Best electric blanket I’ve had! Very soft and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Love this blanket!! I have one for 2 different bedrooms and sent another to my son. They’re very soft. The heat is gradual, so don’t expect quick warmth. I turn it on an hour or so before bedtime so it isn’t cold getting into bed. Then I turn it to low for sleeping. Also, I have an extra quilt over it so low is perfect. If you put a thick quilt over it, you get more warmth. *The first blanket I received didn’t work. I contacted the company, tried their trouble shooting suggestions (which didn’t work) and they immediately sent out another. I haven’t had any trouble with the three I have.
customer_reviews.author: Bernsie82

customer_reviews.title: They don't honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Have used Softheat electric blankets for several years. This last one a twin size purchased October 2016 was the first problem I have had with the controller failing. In short, they are not honoring their warranty for the failed controller. This was a complete waste of my money for a blanket only used occasionally on cold winter days (not often in Texas). I will be filing a complaint with BBB as well Find another brand folks.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: SO WARM.
customer_reviews.text: I have this under a down comforter and over a sheet, and it has kept me so warm during the deep freeze. It doesn't necessarily get hot to the touch, but it is very warm. It's almost hard to explain. Very soft and cozy. I use it even when it's not plugged in. The cord is VERY long, which is nice but it's almost too long. I also use one as a throw blanket when I'm in my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heats Camper Bed
customer_reviews.text: We use this blanket to heat our camper bed before going to bed. Our camper has a short queen mattress--this full size blanket is perfect for this. It warms the memory foam topper we have and then we turn it off because for us using the heating is often too warm. We were surprised that the blanket itself is very warm and soft without heating it. For a camper the full size is perfect for a camper queen.
customer_reviews.author: EKel

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 months with only a 1 month return policy.
customer_reviews.text: The blanket took forever to heat. We would have to turn it on an hour before my husband with ALS got into bed. After 2 months it stopped heating in most areas of the blanket. With only a 1 month return policy I would caution anyone considering purchasing this electric blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This made my wife happy and her feet too. It's very plush, flexes very freely and maintains heat excellently. I do not believe there is a better electric blanket to be bought, and I would not hesitate to buy another if this one eventually must be replaced. I would stay away from other blankets unless it is too pricey for you; on the other hand, I believe it is well worth the investment. Its size is fitted well, but if you have a "blanket pulling hog" it can run a little short in width. It purports to be low-voltage which would mean it does not get as warm. I live at 5600' elevation and cold nights were never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Saving money in winter
customer_reviews.text: I live in Maine, it gets super cold in winter, and it's not so warm even in spring or fall. This saves me so much money on heating cause heating bill can go up to 400 dollars a month (yes, I set the thermostat at 60 for a month and I paid 400 dollars that month). My bills are much lower now with this. And the feeling when you get in a warm bed on a cold day...you only know if you have experienced it. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric blanket based on 1st night of use.
customer_reviews.text: This blanket replaces a 3 year old electric blanket that has given up the ghost. We have also owned a number of electric blankets over the years & feel that we are decent judges of an electric blanket. This blanket (SoftHeat, queen size) is plush & heats quite well when compared to our old blanket in its better days. Before purchasing we read some comments in the Amazon reviews that the connectors in this SoftHeat blanket were not very good. While not made of heavy duty plastic they are also not flimsy. We have found the connectors to be adequate to the job & have no complaints about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: My older son and I are thrilled to have a queen-size heated blanket that does such a good job. No wires are felt and we use it quite differently. I use it to just take the chill off the bed when I climb in, setting it on 1 on only 1 side. My son uses a # 5---God only knows why because that's too warm for me (a little old lady). It is soft and was priced well. We have not laundered it yet.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Fox

customer_reviews.title: Look for a different brand...So Dissapointed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one size Queen blanket and one size King blanket for my home. The blankets are soft and the dials are very optimal and easy to see in the dark. Within one month, the Queen sized blanket stopped heating on one side. Fortunately, the seller replaced it at no cost. Less than three months later, one side (once again) stopped heating. It's too late for a refund, so I'm out. Last week, my King sized blanket stopped heating on one side. NOW I have TWO non-working electric blankets. I had not washed the blankets yet, so I know that was not the issue. So dissapointed in these purchases.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love the soft heat this blanket produces and low voltage technology!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best heating blanket there is in the market in my opinion. I love the soft heat and even heat distribution that it produces - so cozy and comforting throughout chilly nights! I also love that it is very lightweight and best of all, its low voltage technology so I don't have to worry about potential health concerns caused by EMI. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Happyshopgal

customer_reviews.title: Like the thin wires
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the old school ones I love the thin wires, and the fact that it is low voltage across my body. I am an electrical engineer and was concerned about all the issues people have had with the wires in the connector with poor resistive connections that actually caught fire. I tried to look at this connector to examine the soldering but it is up inside the blanket and I could not get to it, I did not want to rip it out of the fabric. So I hope mine behaves as fires are no joke and too many people have complained, WITH PICTURES, for it to not be real.
customer_reviews.author: snooker

customer_reviews.title: Gentle warmth and don't feel wiring.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my queen size bed and it is a generous fit. I followed the advice at starting with the highest temperature and then working down to the setting I prefer. It takes the chill out of the sheets but doesn't feel particularly warm to the hand. However once under the covers the gentle warmth is apparent. My old blanket cycled on and off and this is quiet and the ten hour shut off worked just fine. Have had for a month so can't answer as to durability or whether it is easy to clean. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: fe.shopper

customer_reviews.title: SoftHeat......how about NoHeat.
customer_reviews.text: One of the most important reasons we have an electric blanket is to be able to turn it on before bed and have nice warm bed to crawl into on a cold winter night. If that's what you're looking for look elsewhere. This blanket doesn't do that. It will warm up some when you're under it but not as fast or as warm as the Biddeford we replaced. So it's returned and we'll get a new Biddeford. The old one lasted 8 years and still worked--it was just getting threadbare.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca wallace

customer_reviews.title: Finally! An electric blanket that doesn't feel like one!
customer_reviews.text: If, like me, you have a phobia about electric blankets stemming from a fear of being electrocuted and/or nightmarish memories of the ones grandma had in the 70s that would literally roast you like a suckling pig if you weren't careful, this is the blanket for you. This is soooo cuddly and soft, the wires are nearly impossible to detect in it and it doesn't get HOT, it just keeps you cozy. I suggest using this under your comforter for maximum effect/preheating your bed. It really makes a difference in comfort when the temperature drops below zero and if it's not that cold, you can simply unplug it and keep it on the bed as an extra layer.
customer_reviews.author: K2GQ

customer_reviews.title: Defective and has been returned. We would gladly pay more if it was made here AND worked properly!
customer_reviews.text: So sad. We bought this as a replacement for the same brand of blanket we had bought (and really loved) five years ago. After one night’s use, one controller seemed stuck on high despite the dial reading “low:” we could have cooked bread under the blanket. It was actually scary. I’m very sad. If it could be properly manufactured here in the good old USA with some quality control and American pride, I would gladly pay more. Betcha others would too. Anyone listening?
customer_reviews.author: JP Jersey

customer_reviews.title: No no no
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and thicker fabric, wires barely noticeable and basic, no nonsense control are the positives. The amount of heat put out is really pathetic. Sort of like “Was the cat just lying here?” Very disappointed as I was looking forward to this blanket and it had been highly rated. There is some light warmth but you are looking for real heat do not buy this blanket-the worst I’ve ever had. Sorry..
customer_reviews.author: bchwlkr

customer_reviews.title: Personally I love getting into a warm bed in a colder room
customer_reviews.text: So far I have purchased about 6 of these last year. I have had zero problems with any of them, all have been through the wash a few times. The one's I bought as gifts for others have gotten rave reviews. Personally I love getting into a warm bed in a colder room, this works perfect for me. Heat control easy to use and accurate. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B Griff

customer_reviews.title: Controllers constantly go bad. 3 in 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worst blanket I've ever owned. I bought it because it said it would not pill and it doesn't, so, I'm really glad about that, however, after a few years of owning this blanket, I've gone through somewhere between 6 and 8 controllers. Fortunately, the blanket was replaced once, including controllers, by Hammacher Schlemmer because they have a full money back guarantee. I bought this one in April of 2016 from Amazon and 8 months later, now in December, both controllers are bad and I've already had one of them replaced and the replacement that I received was bad right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: David Santo

customer_reviews.title: Really good blanket.
customer_reviews.text: We went to a split king bed and needed to replace our 6 zone heated mattress pad that we liked VERY much. I do miss having my feet turned up higher than the rest of the bed, but this is a very nice blanket. The wires are almost impossible to feel and the softness is great. Really good blanket and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg E.

customer_reviews.title: Warm bed even in a chilly bedroom.
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is soft and gives a nice gentle Heat. Because we live in the center of Alaska our winter nights are a bit chilling (bedroom temp is between 55 and 60 degrees). We turn the blanket on high about two hours before bedtime. The bed is nice and snuggly warm when we go to bed. We then turn the blanket down and it provides perfect heat all night.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Try another brand!
customer_reviews.text: First one I purchased stopped working after a month. Called the company and was able to get another one. It has a five year warranty. Had to cut off label and send in a piece of the blanket to them. I received another one but it was of less quality so I was disappointed but happy to have an electric blanket that worked. So I thought! Right away one controller did not work and the other shut off after a few seconds. So disappointed! Now going on a third replacement . Haven’t received it yet but will update.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy B.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the wife's feet toasty warm!
customer_reviews.text: My wife suffers from awful foot cramps at night when her feet get cold. This little beauty fist the bill perfectly! No more cramps, and she can adjust the temperature easily! The outer covering is not as soft as she'd like, but it is an excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Truly “soft” heat with this blanket
customer_reviews.text: This blanket says is it “soft heat” and that is a exactly what it provides. A nice, even warmth, that is comfortable all night. I don’t wake up In the middle of the night because it is too hot like most electric blankets.
customer_reviews.author: JOAN

customer_reviews.title: Please do not buy this garbage product
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in the beginning, but it did not last. I have had a heat blanket in the past but wanted one for my new bed. I knew that you have to be a little more careful with them than a normal blanket. I had assumed that the reviews saying how they didn't last were because people were mistreating them. But I can say that I was gentle with this blanket. And after a month one half didn't work and a few weeks later the other half stopped. I should have written this review earlier but I typically don't write reviews. But I'm now awake in the middle of the night, and cold because this stupid blanket is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Ainslie

customer_reviews.title: I love this blanket
customer_reviews.text: I love this blanket . I have had one for many years and it is time for a new one. Many of my friends have purchased one and praise it, no complaints. I keep my home cool and am snuggled warm under this soft ( don’t feel wires ) blanket. I start off on high and when warmed, I switch it to # 2 for the night.I have washed it ( hang dry ) and the softness doesn’t change. I highly recommend this blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Luvsnow

customer_reviews.title: My Mistake!
customer_reviews.text: I had written a review saying that the blanket stopped working after one month. I had unplugged it and replugged it to check and had no positive response. When I talked to the service attendant, she advised me to disconnect the blanket from the wire (a simple task) , reconnect the blanket to the wire and try it again. It then worked. I am most gratified by the service of this company and the simple correction of a problem that was really not a problem all. A very nice product and company
customer_reviews.author: John Caro

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Blanket Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this blanket. It really doesn't feel hot to the touch, but when you get in bed, it is awesome. The whole bed feels warm - there are literally NO hot spots. Even the bottom sheet feels warm. My husband says it is like getting into a warm bath. The wires really are small and you can't feel them at all, and the blanket itself is of high quality. I really wish I had bought this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: logcabinliving

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this blanket until we had it about 2 weeks. Then it stopped working, so would not purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Kaykay

customer_reviews.title: Quick, safe and effective warming.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electric blanket I’ve owned. It claims to be low voltage and works using direct current, not alternating current. I find it gets plenty warm enough for me, and it does so very quickly. It’s got an auto shut off after 10 hours of continuous use, a great safety feature. The 5 year warranty is the best I could find for any electric blanket at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Warranty no good
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS BLANKET! I purchased this blanket on January 3, 2018. It showed a 5-year warranty. One side of the blanket quit working. My attempts to contact the warranty provider have met with total failure. I used the email address listed in the literature that came with the blanket and received back a message that that email address did not exist. I tried to access the web site listed and received the message that it did not exist. I called the 800 number listed and received the message that the message box was full and could accept no more messages.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Must have for drafty homes or apartments!
customer_reviews.text: I used to live in a really drafty apartment and this thing was phenomal I’m warming up a bed. I also prefer my room cold so I would open the window in the winter to rapidly cool my room (radiator heating) but everyone hates a cold bed. This perfectly warms your bed to a desired temperature you can set by using the dials. Even now with non drafty apartment this makes a great blanket if you don’t want to use the electric heating feature, just don’t plug in any of the dial or wall cables.
customer_reviews.author: Nick LoVetere

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting, I didn’t realize it was fleece. It is unattractive as well as it feels very uncomfortable. Returning item as it was not used or completely opened
customer_reviews.author: Sammieb

customer_reviews.title: Cord at bottom of blanket always loosens then a perfectly good blanket doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 4 of these over the years and they are wonderful. Until one of the plug ins at the bottom of the blanket gets loose and it won't stay on. I tried reaching the company, but no one answers. I heard they had excellent warranty people but no one will answer any extension. The last 2 I bought 2-23-17 and in that time, both blankets did the same thing! I was hoping to be able to get another controller unit but I can't reach anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie P.

customer_reviews.title: 10 hours for a month straight!
customer_reviews.text: We had our pups in the winter time and the garage floor was freezing. We put a carpet down then this blanket and then a thick vinyl floor. It kept the floor at 75 degrees. at first we used another heating pad to keep the pups at a higher temp but as they grew we no longer needed it. I can truly say this blanket ran for a month straight 10 hours at a time, back to back.
customer_reviews.author: J. mullins

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for previous blanket
customer_reviews.text: Love the dual-zone control, gentle heat, and very fine wires. The red-illuminated backlit numbers are great too, can see them easily at night without lighting up the room with them. I'm very satisfied, would buy this again - but expect it will last a long time so I won't need to!
customer_reviews.author: rshinks

customer_reviews.title: This product headed for Garbage Bin. I'll take the $$$ loss
customer_reviews.text: Model LVBQ-H2: Left power supply unit 4HFI malfunctioned the second night. Model C-B17 Sparking and wouldn't function. I'll buy locally! This product headed for Garbage Bin. I'll take the $$$ loss. My Wife and I called 1-800-299-1378 approx Ten Times Monday-Tuesday. Recording Device Replied, "No One at desk at this time"
customer_reviews.author: Big bad Bear

customer_reviews.title: I love this blanket
customer_reviews.text: You hardly know there are wires in this blanket and the controls work well. It is lightweight but very warm when the controller is on high. The blanket does not feel very warm to the touch, but is actually toasty warm when you get under the covers. We have one of these blankets in each bed in our home during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: SueRobTx

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This blanket was fabulous when I first got it. It was cozy, way to use, and did exactly what I wanted it to. However, I noticed that after the first couple nights using it, the cord that plugs into the end of the blanket kept popping out. That was annoying, but I could just wake up, plug it back in, and I was fine. After about two months of use, the blanket stopped working altogether. It doesn't turn on at all. The plug won't stay plugged in. I am so highly disappointed. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: MamaD

customer_reviews.title: Cozy and you don’t feel the wires
customer_reviews.text: We love this blanket! We tried a different, normal voltage blanket, but we could feel the wires, not comfortable. I don’t feel the wires at all in this blanket. And I like the fact that it’s low voltage. The material is very soft and plush. Like the instructions say, the blanket does nit feel warmto the touch while pre-heating, but feels nice and warm as soon as you get under it. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Valjean

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: The blanket is very soft with a nice thickness, and a nice light brown/beige color. It does not have those thick heavy wires running through it. I can not say about the temp/heat because I gave it as a gift (for children) who really needed the heated blanket. I can say I am grateful for the bargin price on the brown color. A child in need put electric blankets on his wish list for him and his older brother and the only way I could afford to give away two electric blankets was with this great buy. and my Amazon earned points :)
customer_reviews.author: Jean9

customer_reviews.title: My love lasted until night 1
customer_reviews.text: I got this and wasnt inpressed by the fabric, it looked washed and old, but it was cozy and as soon as I put it on the bed and heated it I loved how warm and gentle the heat was. I went to bed. About 3 hours later I couldnt stand it and had to peel it off because of the oil/chemical smell. I could smell it a little when I initially opened the bag, but it had been in a plastic bag so I figured maybe it would go away but it just got overwhelming and worse. This will go back in the morning. Incredibly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: One side did not work
customer_reviews.text: I received a discount from Amazon because (and I quote) "Item will come in original packaging. Packaging will be damaged.". I didn't realize one side of the blanket would not work (queen size). I would have thought Amazon would let me know the product was "damaged" and not the "packaging". I learned my lesson there!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K.

customer_reviews.title: Beware-FIRE HAZZARD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this overpriced POJ before reading the reviews. Big mistake. Apparently, they can burn your house down, and the wires are so thin they break easily. AVOID! I returned mine unopened.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Educator

customer_reviews.title: Don't Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this electric blanket is horrible. It feels like it was purchased from a very low quality 2nd hand store. It doesn't sit nicely on the bed, and even though you can't see the wires, there are all kinds of little indentations which is ugly. I don't know about the durability, or if it is easy to clean because I have only had it for a few weeks. We are off to Bed Bath and Beyond to see if we can find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, nothing happened
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents, when my Dad was going through terminal stages of cancer. It helped him regulate his body temperature when he felt extremely cold. One word of warning--don't use it with oxygen. My Mom didn't read that warning from the hospice book until Daddy was gone. Fortunately, nothing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Not a durable Product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this blanket the end of January 2017 and it didn't last for even 1 year before the controls no longer worked. Only used during winter months, so maybe a total of 4 months. Paid $144 plus tax and this was a complete waste of money! Do not recommend products by Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.author: celodea

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm and soft - early controller fail?!
customer_reviews.text: Jan 2018: Soft and cuddly, but very lightweight. Love the idea that it is low voltage and saves power while keeping us toasty. Dual controls (I bought thje Queen size) are perfect allowing us to choose our level of warmth. Replaced a 12+ year old blanket that had gotten quite worn. This blanket is both longer and wider than the old one -- that helps too when you're sharing. Update 4/9/2018: Controller on one side has failed. Turns on light which goes out after 1-2 seconds. Unplugging and replugging doesn't help. Other side works. Contacting manufacturer as has 5 yr warranty...
customer_reviews.author: KathleenG

customer_reviews.title: Best blanket ever... Except for the plug doesn't stay plugged into the blanket 😔
customer_reviews.text: I love this blanket. You hardly feel the wires because they are so nice and thin. I don't need to crank it to 10 to feel the heat like other electric blankets. I usually use it at 1-4 depending on the weather. My animals love this blanket too and will sneak into my bed with me now. The only reason I didn't give 5 starts is because the cord is constantly unplugging itself from the blanket. Grr. Thinking of duck taping or using superglue to keep it plugged into the blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Julie F.

customer_reviews.title: Company stands behind their product!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW! I Bought this for Christmas last year. It does take a LONG TIME to heat up. But as the months rolled by slowly one side of the king blanket got cold spots and now the other side died all together. Tried switching the dials around but the blanket itself is broken.... Very disappointed so I wrote a 1 star review and emailed the company not expecting anything to be done. But lo and behold the company responded, they asked for a few serial numbers on the blanket and controllers and a couple weeks later a Brand New blanket arrived in the mail! I was SHOCKED! I was not expecting this and am now a VERY Satisfied Customer!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment: Too heavy and too warm even before heating.
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is too heavy, too warm without heating it. For me it’s a burden because I wanted a blanket which only occasonally needed warming. But this one is too warm without heating. I’m not going to return it. Shall give it away to some poor person who might be able to use it, and try again with some other brand
customer_reviews.author: Violetta Smart

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Over priced and poor quality. One side of the blanket quit working with in 6 months. Now that colder weather is upon us I went out to bed bath and beyond today to replace the electric blanket and found Wellrest microfleece warming blanket, with dual controls and adjustable 0-5 hour to 12 hour auto shut off. cost: 119.99. I cannot believe the difference in construction of the blanket and the heavier duty wiring, better quality for essentially the same (similar) price.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Bought full size for my queen bed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Bought full size for my queen bed. Just right size and only one controller to mess with cords etc. No don't need to heat down the sides of my bed where it doesn't touch me. Much better than a dual corded queen or king...cords get tangled as you change out sheets etc. Pain.
customer_reviews.author: clroyal220

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the short time it lasted. I popped for the extra money to get a good one from a “reputable” manufacturer. Save your money. Just buy a regular blanket, or several for the cost of this junk. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: Nice tech, but doesn't breathe and temp varies
customer_reviews.text: Pros: thinner wires than anyone else; low voltage; DC so no electromagnetic field if anyone worries about that: the analog controls are ergonomic and easy to use Cons: temperature varies widely, some nights it's barely warm enough to feel, others it is toasty (I always have it covered with a second blanket and it is next to my skin except for a sheet, otherwise it wouldn't be warm enough). It also does not breathe at ALL, and I wake up soaked with sweat even when it's turned off and being used as my only blanket. I'm wondering if I could replace the fleece with something more breathable. If not, I may be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft, efficient electric blanket!
customer_reviews.text: Love this blanket! It does save electricity, really! Converts from AC to DC. Does not feel warm to the touch, as it says in the directions. Cozy and warm. Have a cat and she is not able to claw through it. It is much thicker than any others are. I have bought/ ordered 2 blankets and neither of them worked as well. Actually, both were already broken? I sent an email to the company that makes them. Told them that I would buy another one, if I needed it! If you want a great blanket (electric) try it! Do not think that you will regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie M.

customer_reviews.title: unless they are all like this. Only a space of about two feet ...
customer_reviews.text: This electric blanket was defective, unless they are all like this. Only a space of about two feet in the center heated up at all and even that was extremely slow and never got hot enough. I ended up returning it, which I don't often find necessary with Amazon. However, I still love Amazon! Kathryn Willis
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn P Willis

customer_reviews.title: New thoughts after one year
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Especially love the dual controls. It feels light and fluffy and you can't feel the wires like you could in the old heating blankets. Changed my rating from 5 stars to 2 stars. Seems I rated it to soon. After having it for 13 months ( actual use time was 3 months in our florida windter.) Now only 25% of it is heating up. Must have broken wires in serveral places. Will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this blanket
customer_reviews.text: Love this blanket. It's lightweight and snuggly and one hardly knows the temperature is "on" except to know you're not getting into a cold bed. My husband has always been leery of electric blankets, but uses this one on setting 5 almost every night. I'm using "4", as our dog also snuggles with me. I'm looking forward to a lower heating bill next month, as we don't use the forced air at night now.
customer_reviews.author: Just Nan

customer_reviews.title: You can't buy a cord if you lose the original
customer_reviews.text: We moved and somehow the cord was separated from the blanket. I contacted the company to purchase a new cord. Without the exact CORD model number you can't purchase a replacement, the actual blanket model doesn't help. They changed cords in 2016 and they are not compatible with the blanket. You have to get an entire new set. My blanket still has 2 more years under warranty. I was offered a 15% off coupon but I'm not sure I'm inclined to purchase from them if that's how things work.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Heats only down center after less than one month
customer_reviews.text: I foolishly did not send in the warantee. I opened the blanket two weeks after I received it, and loved it for a couple of weeks. BUT, After less than three weeks of use, the blanket heats only down the middle. The window for Apple return has closed, and the help desk is not available at the noted product company. I have no use for this blanket, and an so disappointed because I had initially thought I found just want I have wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Itsinthemusic

customer_reviews.title: Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Has been using all winter long and it works great. Soft and easy to use. I usually set it to 3 but it is plenty warm. Put the power on 1 hour before going to bed, then I turn it off when in bed. For some reasons it is super warm all night long.
customer_reviews.author: Surf Cal

customer_reviews.title: Non-functioning after a year on 1 side
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated post. My first post said this was a great product purchased in 2014. Now after having this blanket about a year one side turns on for about 5 seconds then just shuts off. We switched controllers and the same thing happened. We tried other outlets. Nothing on that one side. The rotary dials are very cheap for an expensive blanket. I've noticed other people are having the same problems that we are having so it's obviously an issue with the factory/production of this blanket and not a user issue. We were really pleased but now I'm angry that I spent the money on a well known brand and it's just junk. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Forensic Doc

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I brought this because I had one previously and loved it. This one barely warms the bed in comparison to the previous one I owned. If my dog had not sat on it and covered it in fur, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Avril

customer_reviews.title: Controller did not work...
customer_reviews.text: The controller did not work right out of the package... another piece of junk from China... it is true you don't feel the wires inside the blanket but that is about all that is true... I sent it back the next day... Something is terribly wrong with this blanket and controller if so many are having serious and dangerous problems with it. Please don't buy this blanket...
customer_reviews.author: starhealer

customer_reviews.title: Already stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: While this is an ok electric blanket, it doesn’t quite heat up warm as I would like. UPDATE: purchased this Feb7th, 2019 it’s March 15th, 2019 and it has already stopped working. Save your money and don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Pinks

customer_reviews.title: Quit after four months
customer_reviews.text: ... and two of them were summer months. It doesn't get hot, but it gets warm enough. Still looking for a decent, reliable electric blanket that's not super thick, one that can be used as a regular blanket during warmer months. Amazon's "choice" is a Sunbeam model that only has one controller, even in a queen. That's dumb.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 1.5 years, do not buy. Impossible to contact company for "5 year warranty" assistance
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay plugged in to blanket very well.
customer_reviews.text: Loved how it kept me so warm and cozy at night. But was quite disappointed that it just stopped working 😞. Although I've had it for 1 year. I expected it to last much longer. Will only give it 2 stars for that reason. Not sure i would recommend this blanket for purchase if ya want it to last. Also it doesnt stay plugged in at the blanket part very well.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Died after a month of use!!!! Poor quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I truly loved this blanket when it arrived. I live in NJ & it has been cold hear since Oct. I have had the blanket on my bed for about a month. I woke up last night freezing and saw the controller was off. I turned it back on and saw the light come on for about a half a minute & then it went out again. The other side of the blanket still works but the side I sleep in does not! I would like to get a new controller but can't even contact the selker thru amazon. Im extremly disappointed as this blanket was not cheap & shouldn't die after a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Twinkles

customer_reviews.title: worst experience ever
customer_reviews.text: First trial: defective! I can barely feel the heat even it is in high mode. Return for a replacement 2nd trial: worst experience ever!! The replacement blanket has sign of use as if they sent me a return of another customer. I tried to use it anyway but it was worse than the first blanket. Both was in high mode but this replacement feel no warm. I'm sending it back to get another replacement. This will be the last trial. I will update more later
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blanket Size
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it doesn't get too hot, but the size didn't totally fit my bed. I have a king size bed and have tried to get a blanket to fit that size. The one I ordered is too long for the bed and has to be folded up at the bottom. I looked at numerous heated blankets to find one that fit my bed, but all of them were too big until I came across this one which is still too big on one side. However, it is okay and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: iolavola

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfy !
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this blanket. The micro fleece is just the right weight and softness. It stays in place and doesn't slide off or slip down in the bed like a fleece blanket does. I don't tuck it under the mattress yet it stays in place. It's the first blanket I've bought that completely satisfied my every need.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: So much for the 5 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE One year in, the controller stopped working and its impossible to contact the company for service. I don't know what's so hard about creating a reliable electric blanket, but you would think that for $100 you'd get at least an attempt. Took two tries to get one that works, and it's EXTREMELY slow to heat - as in several hours. I've had many types of electric blankets, and while it's very nice, I would not purchase again as it doesn't provide enough heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great electric blanket!
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is wonderful! I have one in my RV and then bought a Beautyrest brand which stopped working after a year. I bought another one of these (when I finally found it again) and it is just as great as my other blanket. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis-Rae

customer_reviews.title: because the blanket is otherwise nice: you cannot feel the wires
customer_reviews.text: We will be returning this blanket. A wire broke at the connector on the foot of the blanket. By sheer luck, our break did not scorch the blanket or start a fire, as other raters here have experienced. If I were manufacturing this product I would never have used such a flimsy, unsafe connector in a place where a lot of motion or tension was possible and even expected. It's a shame, though, because the blanket is otherwise nice: you cannot feel the wires, the nap holds the blanket on the bed and the controls are fine. For this price, I expect a robust & quality product, not something that is going to burn my house down.
customer_reviews.author: David Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Barely warm
customer_reviews.text: OK, my husband said he could feel that it was a little warm, and that was on the highest setting. Not meant to warm you up. Maybe meant to give you a little warmth for the night, but I like to turn an electric blanket on 30min before bed and crawl into a WARM bed. Wasn't happening with this blanket. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jill K

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use at the kids house last Thanksgiving used it 4 days, came back to the kids for Thanksgiving and one side is dead.
customer_reviews.author: bigdog

customer_reviews.title: Climate control.
customer_reviews.text: We moved to the south and didn’t expect the cool nights. The electric blanket makes it easier for us to adapt to the ever changing temperatures. We bought a king and wish it was a few inches wider. It’s fine when there isn’t people in the bed but a couple of inches would help with the blanket tug of war situation. I like how one side can be at a different temperature than the other.
customer_reviews.author: doncin

customer_reviews.title: Controller no good.
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine the first year. The controller wouldn't work when I put the blanket back on this winter. I have another make of electric blanket, king size with dual controllers. The controllers are the SAME make. None out of 3 controllers works this year. 2 won't even light up. The other one lights up for 1 second, then goes off. No heat! If every maker is using the same controller, it's not much point in buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: spanishacker

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these blankets - unless you don't mind spending all winter waiting for replacements.
customer_reviews.text: When they work, they are great, but I am on the third one since October. Most of the winter was spent waiting for a new blanket. Not only that, but my first replacement was a queen and this last time they sent me a full. I am too tired to mess with this anymore. It's my fault for assuming the firsst time I bought this blanket (yes I bought one before this mess) and I assumed I just got a bad one, so I bought one again. I will use this this winter & find another product next year. This is a great product idea, poorly executed. Hopefully someone will take up the challenge and do it better.
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: It takes over 4 hours for this blanket to warm up.
customer_reviews.text: It takes over 4 hours for this blanket to warm up. If you like to get into a warm bed at night, make sure you turn this blanket on around dinner time. If you are like me and tend to get warmer as the night goes on, expect to be awakened around 2:00 am perspiring because you fell asleep with the blanket on high and could not even tell it was on. Fortunately mine stopped working after 2 winters and now I can buy one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jack W.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous & Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is dangerous. I used it maybe a week and the wires broke away from the control. It's the second I've purchased...the first one only lasted a couple months and just stopped working...I thought it was a fluke and never returned it...as it was past the return window...BUT, I still feel the seller should honor this product and offer a full refund. It is defective and dangerous. DO NOT BUY this product. I would like to know how to contact this seller and get a refund...it's expensive and I've given it TWO attempts...enough!
customer_reviews.author: The Muse

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews and was a little worried at first, especially with the price. But THIS blanket is awesome! Heats evenly and shuts off automatically somewhere around 10-12 hours. I work in a busy ER all night and my legs are killing me by quitting time. But my husband turns my side on low in the mornings before I get home and when I crawl under the covers the aches just melt away! Highly recommend. I purchased the King in cream and the heat strips are so small you can't see them under the top quilt.
customer_reviews.author: medichic28

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I think there were some negative reviews, can't remember. Have had it about 8 months. Works fine, nice quality. I would buy another if needed. I like the light weight. (Cat loves it, too!)
customer_reviews.author: Pclark

product_meta.title: SoftHeat by Perfect Fit | Luxury Fleece Electric Heated Blanket with Safe & Warm Low-Voltage Technology (Queen, Slate Blue)
feature_bullets: MATERIALS: Made from luxurious ultra-soft micro-fleece with built in micro-thin wires for more even heat distribution without the bulkiness.

FEATURES: Patented Safe & Warm non-hazardous low voltage technology is safe in the presence of moisture, will not harm pets, and emits no EMFs. Our patented low voltage technology is the only electric mattress pad technology that is certified as non-hazardous. Single control automatically shuts off after 10 hours for convenience. Giant backlit display with auto dimming feature for night time adjustments with out having to turn on the lights
CARE INSTRUCTIONS: Machine wash in warm water and tumble dry on low setting
